channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2023080889
item.description:
Report E-2023080889

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 16, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 was punctured by a forklift and released its full contents to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed absorbents to the released material and worked them in using hand tools. The crew further deployed a degreasing agent and wiped the surfaces with absorbent pads. All UN3266-impacted material was containerized in two (2) 35-gallon drums for disposal.

DescribePack: LOOSE SAFETY CAP ALLOWING LEAKAGE TO OCCUR GETTING ON A PACKAGE HANDLERS FINGERS. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: CAP WAS TIGHTENED TO MITIGATE FURTHER LIQUID RELEASE FROM OCCURRING. BOX WAS TAKEN TO HMPA FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023080953
item.description:
Report X-2023080953

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-05
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Aug 4th, during the PM sort a shipment of drums were found that had no markings or indications that the drums contained any DG. After investigating the paperwork that was included an SDS was found that identified the inner contents as UN3077 Environmentally Hazardous Substance, solid, n.o.s.(diflubenzuron), 9, PGIII. There were no shippers declarations of dangerous goods with the shipment either. DG Admin advised for the station to hold the shipment until further disposition.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: RICHFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was being unloaded from the trailer and was accidentlly dropped out of the unloaders hands. which in turn caused the damage and leaking to occur. pkg was cleaned up and drummed awaiting disposition. DescribePack: pkg seemed to be in fine condition and well packed inside with partitions and paper to compact it all. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: pkg was quickly brought to qa attention and cleaned up and drummed. anything in the area was cleaned while others were told to stay away from the area. all materials are drummed up and waiting for dispostion.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that 2 of the metal 5 gallon cans of coating (un1139) had been damaged by other freight and had released 10 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023080542
item.description:
Report E-2023080542

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: MILAN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A forklift puncture resulted in the damage of (11) bottles of Porc-A-Clean; a total release of (2) gallons of material onto the cardboard packaging and pallet. A contractor cleaned the release and disposed of the damaged product containers.

item.title: Report E-2023080513
item.description:
Report E-2023080513

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: MASSILLON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While out delivering freight driver observed a drum staged on their trailer slightly leaking. Further investigation revealed that a nail protruding from the pallet the drum was staged on had slightly punctured the bottom of the drum consequently contributing to the unintentional release. The drum was repaired with drum putty and the spilled material cleaned with absorbent materials.

item.title: Report E-2023080569
item.description:
Report E-2023080569

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 31, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1993 was forked and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the loading dock. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted surfaces. ES personnel overpacked the one (1) damaged 55-gallon drum of Lubrizol (UN1993) in one (1) 85-gallon overpack that was planned to be sent back to the shipper by RLC personnel. ES personnel utilized absorbent wipes mixed with a degreasing solution to remove all Lubrizol (UN1993) from the concrete surfaces. All Lubrizol (UN1993)-impacted material was collected in one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal

item.title: Report X-2023080327
item.description:

  • Description: Norfolk Southern personnel found tank car NATX364254 leaking from the top of the car under movement. Upon inspection by a contractor, the leak was found from the manway as the result of a crushed and deteriorated manway gasket. The gasket was replaced and the car returned to transportation.

item.title: Report E-2023070992
item.description:
Report E-2023070992

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7/25/2023, personnel at the CSX Queensgate Yard in Cincinnati, OH, reported AXZZ 32036, a loaded tank car of Xylene Ethylbenzene (ALOX), was observed leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Kraton Chemicals, was notified via CHEMTREC (report #2023-07-25-00327). James Courtney, a CSXT hazardous materials manager, was dispatched to the scene and found (2) of (6) manway cover bolts less than tool tight. The manway bolts were tightened to secure the car for movement inside the yard. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to Kraton Chemicals representative: Gerri Sage (904-316-3655, Gerri.Sage@Kraton.com). Prior to releasing the car into transportation, HEPACO, a CSX response contractor, cleaned the impacted surfaces on the top and sides of the car, inspected the manway gasket, re-secured all manway cover bolts tool tight, and applied manway custody seal #000102. Delay in 5800.1 submission due to online portal not accepting submission.

item.title: Report E-2023070924
item.description:
Report E-2023070924

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: WALBRIDGE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/27/2023, at 1725 hours, personnel in the CSXT Walbridge Yard discovered TILX307496, a residue tank car of Pentanes, leaking from the protective housing. The car was isolated and the shipper Marathon, was notified via CHEMTREC (report 2023-0727-00103). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the liquid line valve partially closed and the secondary closure plug less than tool tight. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers emergency contact: Michael Murray (606-922-4079). Contractor personnel closed the angle valve and secured the secondary closure. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport.

item.title: Report I-2023080021
item.description:
Report I-2023080021

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: MIDDLEBURG HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 6/23/23 at 12:30 am, a ground package coming out of door 37 caught on fire while on the sort aisle conveyor belt. One of the aerosol cans in the package leaked and caught fire. The fire dept was called at 12:31 am and 225 employees were evacuated from the building. The fire was then extinguished by the Base mechanic and Sort Supervisor. At approximately 12:58 am the fire dept gave all clear to go back insidethe building and the sort operation started again after belt cleanup at 1:17 am.
